channel.title: Cloud singles album. Soundcloud > Spotify
channel.description:
https://open.spotify.com/album/2ktx74CaMaSljcXrjH6tmz?si=xngjNFA-TKGL8k6mzPuJIQ
![image|500x500](upload://1egAqDlqZeXF1bREgNpkYzdvDXv.jpeg)
Took advantage of the new distribution feature in soundcloud to gather singles I made in Auxy and published them in a couple clicks. The system is buggy but still provides valuable access to the music outside soundcloud. Enjoy.

item.title: Cloud singles album. Soundcloud > Spotify
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
This is fantastic!
One of my favourite Auxy releases in quite some time.

I might have missed it if not for ThoughtfulNoise’s 90s techno comparison*.
* Remember to tag your tracks people!

Read full topic

item.title: Cloud singles album. Soundcloud > Spotify
item.dc:creator: Offcmd
item.description:
Wow. Nailed the spirit of it and what I am going after.
It’s really nice to hear feedback and specially from this tight community. Thank you.

I also posted this to encourage others to take advantage of the music they already have uploaded to publish widely with this new system which enable this in a few clicks. Easy!

Cheers.

Read full topic

item.title: Cloud singles album. Soundcloud > Spotify
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
I’m three tracks in and gotta say, this is fantastic stuff!

Some of the most interesting Auxy tracks I’ve ever heard.

As an erstwhile listener of abstract techno, this is a great sound.
Not sure if it’s intentional, but, imo, you’ve captured the authentic spirit of early-mid '90s techno — à la the Black Dog, Aphex, etc.

I’ve not followed techno for a while, so maybe this strain of techno is back in vogue. Either way, based on this release, it deserves to be.

Perhaps ironically, even though it’s got strong early-mid '90s techno vibes (and even though you’re far from new here), imo, the quality and follow-through make this a fresh voice/sound in the world of Auxy.

Feeling it. Great work!

Read full topic
